name: Flower-Feather Clan
desc: One of the six tribes of Natlan, also known as Tlalocan. The tribe's people live alongside the Qucusaurs.

customize.text:
Lianca
The First Speaker of the tribe who founded the Flower-Feather Clan.
Crimson-eyed youth
The second Pyro Archon who defeated the Tyrant of Cinder City,

customize.name: Och-Kan
customize.desc: A dragon mixed with a human soul, the ruler of the Cinder City, known as the Python King and Sacred Lord.

customize.name: Menilek
customize.desc: One of the six heroes of Natlan and the bearer of the Ancient NameHe died during the Cataclysm 500 years ago.

customize.text: The hero of the tribe who joined Tenoch and went to the future Mare Jivari during the

customize.name: Khaenri'ahn cataclysm
customize.desc: A disaster that occurred 500 years ago. The Abyss was released into Teyvat and Khaenri'ah was destroyed.

customize.name: Goldflame Qucusaur Tyrant
customize.desc:
A Qucusaurus whose body has attained a supernatural form due to enduring forces that the bodies of modern Saurians cannot control.
Legends say that when the giant Qucusaur who now often dwells in the mountain fog was young, he also once followed the heroes who saved Natlan in their adventures. It is said that one of those heroes once agreed to make the pilgrimage with him together to the volcano, to save his mind back from the brink of insanity that the increasing violent power in his blood was forcing him towards. However, judging from his current title of "Tyrant," that story did not have a happy ending.

customize.text:
.
Taika
The hero of the tribe who went to

customize.name: Ochkanatlan
customize.desc: In order to pursue the great dream in the morning mist and sea of clouds, the warriors who soared the skies never rested for a moment.

customize.text:
about 490 years ago to find the Jade of Return. He never returned from this journey.
Quenin
A tribal warrior who accompanied the group of Adventurers in Ochkanatlan. A

customize.name: Tenebrous Mimiflora
customize.desc:
Abyssal monsters that have descended to this world from the deep, dark depths of a twisted and alien world, they possess a plant-like appearance.
It is said that where the corrosive waves of the dark tide lap, such plant-like dark monsters will grow. But they only bear a superficial resemblance to plants, for it is a form they only adopted to get closer to the tree-like world, that they might extract the necessary concepts from it, and analyze and imitate them.
Some raving lunatics who have lost their minds say that those things that extend out like leaves are actually the beginnings of gates to other worlds.

customize.text: took his form and didn't realize it was a monster, not a human.

customize.name: Bona
customize.desc: An adventurer who went to Ochkanatlan to find the Jade of Return that can cleanse filth. She lived almost 500 years ago.

customize.text: Taika's daughter and an Adventurer who also went to Ochkanatlan. She awakened Och-Kan's spirit from the Core of Chu'ulel and named it Cocouik. She died in Ochkanatlan.

customize.name: Mutota
customize.desc: Chief of the Flower-Feather Clan.

customize.name: Allpa
customize.desc: Elder of the Flower-Feather Clan.

customize.name: Chasca
customize.desc: The Peacemaker of the Tlalocan, the ender of all disputes.

customize.text:
The Peacemaker and a hero of the Flower-Feather Clan, who has been acknowledged by her Ancient Name
Chuychu
Doctor and Chasca's sister. She died in the Abyss invasion.

customize.name: Quahuacan Cliff
customize.desc: Living with the Qucusaurs, this is the home of the tribe known as the Flower-Feather Clan. Every day, members of the tribe fly with the Qucusaurs, patrolling their territory from the air.

customize.name: Qucusaurus Chick
customize.desc:
A young Qucusaur with a light, agile body.
Its neck and wings have yet to fully develop, and it still has a long way to go before it can wield gaseous phlogiston. There are stories of older Qucusaurs pushing younglings off cliffs to encourage them to fly. While the truth of such tales is uncertain, as long as it keeps practicing day and night, there can be no doubt that the soft-feathered fledgling will eventually grow strong and resilient.

customize.name: Qucusaurus
customize.desc:
A Saurian with large, supple wings that can glide through the air for long periods.
It is said that the ancestors of the Qucusaurs were the closest in form to the mighty winged dragons, and that they could soar through the sky like clouds. According to the storytellers, when the greatest of such dragons spread its wings, the entire sky would be blotted out. Of course, the Qucusaurs we see today no longer possess such forms, but the claws they hide within their downy feather coats remain as sharp as ever.

customize.name: Chain Breaker
customize.desc: A jade-adorned longbow. The gentle winds always seem to swirl gently about its string. Legends claim that this weapon was made in a far more ancient era by a dragon artisan.

customize.name: Flower-Wreathed Feathers
customize.desc: A longbow that burns like a flame. The feathers that adorn it are said to have come from the ancient tyrant Ngoubou.

customize.name: Astral Vulture's Crimson Plumage
customize.desc: An ancient longbow crested with red feathers, a sacred relic of the Flower-Feather Clan that has been passed down from generation to generation.

customize.name: Talking Stick
customize.desc: Most people will find this obsidian-inlaid club quite convincing indeed.

customize.name: Scroll of the Hero of Cinder City
Crimson Obsidian Ring
customize.desc: An obsidian ring with engraved patterns styled like those of the Flower-Feather Clan. It is an ancient medium by which the tribe established contact with the deep night. Perhaps its strength can allow you to cross the boundary between this place and a certain other location...

customize.name: Flower-Feather Clan Reputation EXP
customize.desc: Increases your Tribe Reputation Lv. (Flower-Feather Clan)

customize.name: Sing Your Heart Out
customize.desc: A cool-flavored throat lozenge. Said to be the Flower-Feather Clan's secret weapon for soothing their throats and protecting their vocal cords — so eat one and go sing your heart out! Just make sure you don't go overboard, as too much sugar can leave your throat feeling hoarse.

customize.text:
<color=#ffd780>November 11, 2024</color>
Hello, Travelers!
In order to pursue the great dream in the morning mist and sea of clouds, the warriors who soared the skies never rested for a moment. Whether you're looking to explore the local culture and customs or just want to test out your flying skills, the Flower-Feather Clan is the place for you!

imgDesc.text: Living with the Qucusaurs, this is the home of the tribe known as the Flower-Feather Clan. Every day, members of the tribe fly with the Qucusaurs, patrolling their territory from the air.
